title: Facebook Did Not Address Hacking Attack on Popular Grief Support Page for Weeks, Moderators Say
text: Page administrators of Grief the Unspoken say a hacker repeatedly posted disturbing images on the page, which has 500,000 followers.

title: Here's what Mark Zuckerberg has to say about Facebook’s ‘Supreme Court’     - CNET
text: Spoiler alert: The social network has a lot of details to work out.

title: Libra Is Facebook's License To Print Money
text: Facebook can give its currency the scale needed to achieve a stable value by pricing its services in Libra.

title: Tension reportedly grows as Facebook moderators post complaint to internal forum
text: One contractor was fired after including music from blue-collar rocker Bruce Springsteen in his profile, The Washington Post reports.

title: Mark Zuckerberg pushes back on calls to break up Facebook
text: Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley reports on Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's comments at Aspen Ideas festival about breaking up Facebook.

title: Instagram Is Finally Opening Up Some of Its Best Advertising Real Estate
text: With the social media site's core feed saturated with ads, Instagram is looking to squeeze in ads everywhere else.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO dismisses Facebook's digital asset Libra
text: CNBC's Wilfred Frost sat down with Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman to discuss Facebook's new digital asset Libra.

title: Zuckerberg says Facebook oversight board should allow users to elevate appeals on sensitive content
text: Facebook released a new research report Thursday summarizing feedback on its proposed independent body to handle community appeals.

title: Facebook's track record is 'horrific,' says Wedbush's Joel Kulina
text: Joel Kulina, Wedbush Securities head of TMT trading, and Matt McIlwain, Madrona Ventures managing director, join "Squawk on the Street" to discuss Facebook's venture into cryptocurrency amid controversies of regulation and antitrust.

title: Facebook wants to offer 'simple' answers on how its site works
text: The social network isn't changing its policies, just trying to explain them better.

title: Is Breaking Up Hard to Do?
text: Big Tech is now on the federal government’s radar.Partly at issue is anti-competitive tactics employed by these companies. It’s been reported that the Justice Department is preparing an antitrust investigation into some of the largest of these tech giants.

title: Facebook shares rise on Deutsche Bank price-target hike
text: Shares of Facebook Inc. are up 1% in mid-morning trading Thursday following two notes from financial analysts on additional advertising revenue streams for the social-media giant.

title: Capitol Report: Facebook’s crypto plans look a lot like the ones the SEC is trying to stop
text: A bold plan to launch a new cryptocurrency by Facebook and partners looks a lot like the plans of another firm the Securities and Exchange Commission is now suing to stop.

title: Libra Is More Like PayPal Than Bitcoin
text: Libra may be a currency, but it's not much like Bitcoin.

title: Libra Could Compete With Traditional Central Bank Currencies: Kroszner
text: Randall Kroszner, University of Chicago Booth School professor and former Federal Reserve Board member, discusses the potential of Facebook's Libra as a viable currency.

title: How China and Facebook's 'Libra' are driving up Bitcoin's price
text: Bitcoin was on the rise Thursday morning after a sell-off overnight.

title: 10 Names That Are Screaming Stocks to Buy
text: Even in these unstable times, there are still gems to be found. These 10 stocks share a "strong buy" analyst consensus rating from the Street and compelling growth drivers.

title: Facebook scours the globe for ideas about its content oversight board
text: In a new report, the social network suggests people around the world want the board to have more power than originally anticipated.

title: Facebook stock heads higher after Deutsche Bank hikes target
text: Shares of Facebook Inc. FB, -0.62% are up 1.1% in premarket trading Thursday after Deutsche Bank analyst Lloyd Walmsley turned more upbeat on the stock, raising his target price to $230 from $220.

title: Facebook outlines ideas for oversight board
text: Facebook Inc  on Thursday released the findings from its consultations with outside experts into its content review process, providing a glimpse into how its plans for a proposed "external oversight board" might take shape.
